required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Etanercept and Sulphasalazine in Ankylosing Spondylitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of Etanercept and Sulphasalazine in Subjects With Ankylosing Spondylitis

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy of etanercept and sulphasalazine in the treatment of Ankylosing Spondylitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Achieving Assessment in Ankylosing Spondylitis (ASAS 20)
primary_outcome.description: ASAS measures symptomatic improvement in Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS) participants ASAS = 4 domains: participant global assessment of disease activity, pain, function, inflammation. ASAS 20 = 20% improvement from baseline and an improvement ≥ 10 units on a 0-100 scale (0=no disease activity; 100=high disease activity) for ≥ 3 domains, and no worsening in remaining domain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ankylosing Spondylitis Quality of Life (ASQoL) Total Score Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: ASQoL is a questionnaire to assess disease specific quality of life. It consists of 18 statements that are relevant to the physical and mental conditions for a patient with Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS). Each statement is answered by the patients as a "Yes" (scored as 1) or "No" (scored as 0). All item scores are summed to give a total score. Scores can range from 0 (good QoL) to 18 (poor QoL).

intervention.description: Sulphasalazine: The target dose for SSZ is 1.5 g (3 tablets) twice daily orally. Subject start the oral TA at 0.5 g daily for the first week and increase by 0.5 g every week until a daily dose of 3 g. Is achieved by the start of study week 5 of the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of ankylosing spondylitis
- Active ankylosing spondylitis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Complete ankylosis of spine
- Previous treatment with etanercept

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited in multiple countries from December 2005 to September 2007.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects were screened up to 4 weeks in a 2:1 randomization ratio.

group.title: Sulphasalazine
group.description: Sulphasalazine (SSZ) titration up to 3 g daily

group.title: Sulphasalazine
group.description: Sulphasalazine (SSZ) titration up to 3 g daily

outcome.title: Number of Patients Achieving Assessment in Ankylosing Spondylitis (ASAS 20)
outcome.description: ASAS measures symptomatic improvement in Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS) participants ASAS = 4 domains: participant global assessment of disease activity, pain, function, inflammation. ASAS 20 = 20% improvement from baseline and an improvement ≥ 10 units on a 0-100 scale (0=no disease activity; 100=high disease activity) for ≥ 3 domains, and no worsening in remaining domain.
outcome.population: All randomized patients who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 post-baseline efficacy evaluation. Last observation carried forward approach (LOCF) used for missing data imputations.

group.title: Sulphasalazine
group.description: Sulphasalazine (SSZ) titration up to 3 g daily

measure.title: Number of Patients Achieving Assessment in Ankylosing Spondylitis (ASAS 20)
measure.description: ASAS measures symptomatic improvement in Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS) participants ASAS = 4 domains: participant global assessment of disease activity, pain, function, inflammation. ASAS 20 = 20% improvement from baseline and an improvement ≥ 10 units on a 0-100 scale (0=no disease activity; 100=high disease activity) for ≥ 3 domains, and no worsening in remaining domain.
measure.population: All randomized patients who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 post-baseline efficacy evaluation. Last observation carried forward approach (LOCF) used for missing data imputations.

outcome.title: Ankylosing Spondylitis Quality of Life (ASQoL) Total Score Change From Baseline
outcome.description: ASQoL is a questionnaire to assess disease specific quality of life. It consists of 18 statements that are relevant to the physical and mental conditions for a patient with Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS). Each statement is answered by the patients as a “Yes” (scored as 1) or “No” (scored as 0). All item scores are summed to give a total score. Scores can range from 0 (good QoL) to 18 (poor QoL).
outcome.population: The analysis population was limited to subjects whose native language was English, Hungarian and Dutch.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PIs agreed to allow the sponsor 60 days to review and require changes to presentations or publications but only to protect confidential information and intellectual property, and for the sponsor to file a patent application, as applicable. The PIs also agreed for data to be presented first as a joint, multi-center publication.
